title: Algerian War
summary: The Algerian War, also known as the Algerian Revolution or the Algerian War of Independence,[nb 1] and sometimes in Algeria as the War of 1 November, was fought between France and the Algerian National Liberation Front (French: Front de Libération Nationale – FLN) from 1954 to 1962, which led to Algeria winning its independence from France.[26] An important decolonization war, it was a complex conflict characterized by guerrilla warfare and the use of torture. The conflict also became a civil war between the different communities and within the communities.[27] The war took place mainly on the territory of Algeria, with repercussions in metropolitan France.
